formattedAddress: 1619 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10031, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1619 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10031-6103, USA

editorialSummary.text: Cool, casual coffee bar near City College serves breakfast & light fare with occasional live music.

originalText.text: Was looking for a lunch place, the line was almost out the door, very friendly, food, reasonably priced, got a turkey Panini that came with a salad for $9.50, pretty good for Manhattan. Cherry danish was pretty good too, coffee was average. Best thing about the place is you can get a variety of food, price is right, and the vibe is good. Not a fancy place, best if you want to grab lunch to go.

originalText.text:
Had a pretty good lunch here recently. I ordered on seamless and picked it up and it looks like the prices are higher to order through that than in store. They were really busy and it took 30! mins for my food to be ready which I was pretty annoyed by. The inside is small and they have some outdoor seating. I ordered the Italian wrap and it was good.  I‚Äôve had it from here before and this time wasn‚Äôt as good, honestly.  I also tried the spicy beef sandwich with sauce on the side. It was good but entirely fell apart so it was hard to eat.  Overall, I‚Äôd say the food was good but the wait was way too long for me.

It looked like a lot of people were getting coffee and special drinks so maybe I‚Äôll try one instead next time.

originalText.text: omg prob my fav spot after my house & the bookstore, i absolutely love getting food here, it‚Äôs next to uni so it‚Äôs like literally perfect, they have amazing breakfast options, super healthy also and v affordable, only $4 ish for a sausage egg & cheese! my fav lunch items is the greek avocado on a spinach wrap and the mozz panini w salad and sometimes w jalape√±o chips (rlly spicy)!but the BEST thing is prob the mozz & peppers and the iced vanilla chai w oat, their iced coffee is also good bc it‚Äôs only $4 and comes with an espresso shot so it‚Äôs like perfect when studying, also the muffins are daily baked (my fav is the double choc muffin w butter) and when it‚Äôs cold it‚Äôs perfect to study but it gets like rlly busy! üéß‚òïÔ∏è

originalText.text: It‚Äôs in the pricey side, but that can be excused since it is located in Manhattan and it‚Äôs your local bakery. It tastes delicious and is convenient when coming out for lunch from CCNY. Glad a friend introduced me to this place, because now I haven‚Äôt stopped‚Ä¶ üòÇ

originalText.text: Cafe One is a great place for breakfast and lunch. We've seen many students lined up there from City College and they know where the good food is at near their school so we went too. The line can be long but it's a great cafe. We love how they support the students by placing their artwork on the walls. As for the food, we enjoyed their everything bagel with cream cheese for breakfast. It was delicious, the bagel tasted fresh and the cream cheese was creamy. They put a lot of everything seasoning which is good because some places skimp on everything seasoning. Glad they make it worth it. We also ordered their Black Bean Burger for lunch. This was a great vegetarian option for a burger. It tasted good with the seasoning on it as well. The bun was soft and the lettuce and tomato were a great fresh combo with the black beans.
